Pros
1. Great screen and performance

3. Clear OS, update policy

Cons
1. Product finish , gum marks , dust inside panels

Positive

1. Software is good, top notch.
2. Battery is good (charger should have included in the box)

Negetive
1. Camera in daylight is good, but at nights and underlight is worse.
2. Should have been thinner in width.
3. It gets slightly heated up while playing pubg in HDR mode.
4. Costly at this price range.
Eyes closed or open, the best phone in this budget FY2022.

‚Ä¢The best thing about the phone is the battery. The amazing battery lasts for about 30 hours in one full-charge for me.

‚Ä¢I am not a gamer. Keeping that in mind, the performance of the phone is quite good.

‚Ä¢The back-camera is also good but could have been much better for 48-MP. The front camera is also not bad. The macro lens is very good for a 2-MP lens.

‚Ä¢ Overall, I love this phone. No complains.

Review_title: Far better than the Chinese Crap!
Review_text: Very well balanced phone - Camera, Battery, Display & Antennas - best in this budget. Additionally, an excellent software experience!

Bought this as a second phone. Was looking for a cheap reliable one. So went for a Samsung phone. Given the price, the display, call clarity and performance are good. Camera is also reasonably good. But then if camera was main function one needed, the budget would have to be stepped up. So overall, a very good phone for everyday use

Camera is not as per expectations,there is nothing like 48MP quality in clicked images,performance of front camera is also not good.
Performance is good in this price range,battery is awesome and display is ok.

Pros:
i) In this budget Samsung F12 is a good phone.
ii) Very nice interface, easy to use, 90 Hz refresh rate.
iii) 6000mAh battery back up is too good for heavy use.
Cons:
i) Front camera is very average in quality.
ii) Little bit heavy due to 6000mAh battery.
iii) Sound quality is comparatively low with other smartphones.

A nice product in affordable range. After Using Vivo, Redmi and Micromax , which boast of good Camera quality and attractive accessibility options but finally ends in software/ hardware issue, sluggish performance i have returned to Samsung after 3 years.

Review_title: as always another gem from Moto
Review_text: as always a good phone from Motorola, price is good and features as always good with vanilla/plain android experience. very light and easy to hold navigate. using for almost 5 days now and no complaints. no lag, no perf issues. battery is good and runs 1.5 days almost with heavy usage.

*5 star rating (minus 1 star)*
Overall pretty impressed with Motorola's offering at this price. Excellent display, good camera, good battery, bloatware free near-stock Android experience, Moto's excellent tweaks, nice specs - highly recommended.
Edit: Would've rated 5 stars, but only drawback for an average daily user is the absence of compass sensor, without which the direction arrow in the Maps doesn't work properly.

Review_title: No Realme Link. Only DIZO App connnection. So, No Google Fit
Review_text:
Well, The watch is good, Has a lot of watch faces when connected with the Dizo app. Good enough battery life and charging time. But, few things I couldn't skip saying
- It only connects with DIZO App. Watches like Dizo Watch Pro, Dizo Watch, Realme Watch S/S Pro Realme Watch Pro/ 2 Pro connects with Realme Link Application and can sync data with Google Fit.
But somehow they didnt add Dizo Watch 2 into Realme Link and the QR Fails to recognise device in Realme Link.

Good product in this range, activity algorithm is so nice and Zepp app makes it more lovable as sync with Strava. Only one issue is battery, it doesn't last 10 days, i have charge in in 5 6 days, may be because of my high activity usage. Overall product is good to recommend.

Sedentary reminder reminds you timely to exercise.

You will get call/message and other notifications without any delay.

It was good doesn't look like a true LED. It's just LCD with LED Backlit. Using HDMI Cable brings a feel of full HD on the screen. But there is one defect that I don't like at all, as it was present in my last DELL monitor (about the same price range) too. It is that the screen is half dark on the upper half and light on the lower half. The more you tilt the monitor vertically up or down, the more you can see the differences.

Although the monitor is great, and very vibrant, I would like to suggest the seller to change the product detail as this monitor only support vga and hdmi input and not dvi as shown in pictures, and another thing, the mac resolution is 1344 x 728 and not 1600 x 900 as mentioned on the details page. Other than that, it's a very good monitor with a little wider fov.

You can use it with lights on or off without having to adjust the brightness constantly. Been using it for a week and I haven't had any dead pixels yet. There is a slight light bleeding In the bottom 2 corners which is very common for ips panel displays. Highly recommended for movie streaming or console gaming.

The display is good, and I use to as my daily office monitor for work from home. The platform which I work on, the websites looks perfect and I do not have to squint my eyes like I used to do in my 14" laptop provided by my office. Sure there is pixel bleeding from the edges, and pixels can be separated if you look very closely, but who will go that close to a monitor. Review_title: The power cable is the worst.
Review_text:
It's probably a great monitor. I can't turn it on because of the power cable.
It's a large 16A power cable.
It doesn't fit in most places in India.
Is it too much to provide an adaptor with this monitor if you're selling in India where this cable won't fit?
My disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined. Thanks, BenQ.

The monitor is aesthetically very pleasing with minimum bezzel around the sides except the bottom. The display quality is very good and the colours are fairly accurate. The monitor can be tilted as per liking and has a sturdy base. The monitor is best suited for office and home use with general computing works. It has speakers but they are very tiny and not useful but it has audio output for attaching external speakers.

BenQ 22inch panel monitor looks and work great, easy to assemble. Packaged in very protective manner, deliver was good. Much satisfied with this purchase.
Down side: Volume is considerable low. Power input cord is large 3 pin which generally seen with A/C, refrigerators and washing machines. Its uncommon in household we have many of such sockets at right spot.

It's been a month, i m using the monitor, its working very well, the IPS panel is really nice, viewing angles, colour, sharpness everything is good. Reading, browsing, watching YouTube videos can be done smoothly. Speaker volume is too low but i don't really need them.
What i didn't like about the monitor is that it takes almost 5 seconds to turn on.
Other than that its amazing so i'm rating 5 starts wanted to rate 4.75 but there's no option, so 5 it is.

Superb quality and works fine as expected. Inbuilt sound is bit poor as it was designed to the one who sit just infront of the monitor.

Overall as remaining reviewers said it is a great product.

I bought this monitor after so much research of finding the best 24 inch IPS monitor. Here are the pros and cons.

Pros:
IPS screen provides better colour accuracy & wider viewing angle
3 side borderless screen provides that extra diagonal screen width unlike other monitors which provide 23.8 inch only instead of 24.
Better picture modes for different needs(Gaming, Cinema, Photo Editing etc)
Good refresh rate of 60 hz or 75 Hz with AMD freesync

22MP68VQ and 22MK600M both have same specification except 3 spec

1. 22MP68VQ IS 2016 MODEL BUT 22MK600M IS 2018 MODEL and the Manufacturing date may vary in both the models
2. 22MP68VQ has VGA, DVI, HDMI and audio out ports - 22MK600M has VGA, 2 HDMI and audio out ports

3. MOST IMPORTANT IS DISPLAY (Panel Bit depth)
22MP68VQ is 8 bits panel and 22MK600M is 8 bits (6 bits + FRC) which is low quality and low cost display than 8 Bits panel.

Review_text:

Review_title: Excellent monitor for viewing videos and good for gaming
Review_text:
If you are buying this monitor for gaming, first note that 1080p with 27inch is not a perfect combination and the perfect combination is 1080p with 24 inches, for a 27-inch monitor you need a 1440p resolution. Secondly, you get a good gaming experience only at full resolution and that is at 1080p but on that resolution, fps drops below 20 if you have integrated graphics. So buy this monitor for gaming only if you have a medium-to-high-range graphics card. I write this because it is branded as...

I would recommend to go for below 21inch if it is full hd resolution.

I bought this for Rs.5220 at an offer (including credit card discount). Worth for buying at this price compared to other brands. Good for official (work from home) and personal use. Acer is a good brand gives a better quality and I had a similar monitor which I have used for more than 10 years.

It was good doesn't look like a true LED. It's just LCD with LED Backlit. Using HDMI Cable brings a feel of full HD on the screen. But there is one defect that I don't like at all, as it was present in my last DELL monitor (about the same price range) too. It is that the screen is half dark on the upper half and light on the lower half. The more you tilt the monitor vertically up or down, the more you can see the differences.

Although the monitor is great, and very vibrant, I would like to suggest the seller to change the product detail as this monitor only support vga and hdmi input and not dvi as shown in pictures, and another thing, the mac resolution is 1344 x 728 and not 1600 x 900 as mentioned on the details page. Other than that, it's a very good monitor with a little wider fov.

A really good option if you're looking for a budget gaming monitor. It has display port(which doesn't usually come at this price range) to support Freesync in Nvidia GPUs. Very little to nil backlight bleeding. The IPS glow is evenly distributed. 75hz refresh rate is a good step up but not a great one. The features like black stabilizer and inbuilt crosshair are really useful ones. Eventually, this is the best product you could get at this price range. Go for it without any second thought.

Great product! Overall great monitor for work or general use.

Design and ergonomics:
Premium design and finish. Looks very classy. It's not the slimmest monitor out there but it's uniformly slim rather than being very bulky at the bottom like HP ultra slim monitors. The stand is strong, very stable and metallic. The stand is a bit heavy since it's metallic but the monitor itself without the stand is very light ~2.5kg. The whole body, including the stand and the front chin, has a matte finish...
